intro: Sebastiania bidentata var. odontococca, commonly known as the toothed-sepal sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, toothed sepals and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a glossy, dark green appearance. This variant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display and unique foliage.
